main event: A bright light, similar to a star, was observed changing in brightness, size, and position over Malden, Massachusetts on July 7, 1962.
interesting points: The object appeared solid and was observed for at least 20 minutes.
The object was described as a bright light that changed in brightness, size, and position.
The object was observed visually from the ground.
The weather conditions included a cloudy sky with 2 1/4 miles of visibility and 1/8 cloud cover.
No air traffic was reported in the area at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: A bright light, similar to a star, that changed in brightness, size, and position
